title: Senior Python Developer- Finance
description:
We are looking for a **Senior Python Developer** in finance domain for a global company in **Stockholm.**

**Start is in February 2026, 11 month's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

 **About this opportunity**

Are you passionate about **finance and IT,** we are currently looking for a motivated and dynamic person. You will be part of one of the most important programs for the finance institution, which consists of upscaling credit risk models and frameworks for capital calculation. You will cooperate closely with your colleagues across the finance institution and you will have great possibilities to develop your skills within risk credit area – a field which is in high focus in finance institution.


**What you’ll be doing**:

* Technical lead and expert for the product.
* Develop the Solution design of product.
* Work very closely with product management team to under the requirements.
* Development of python programs using pure python, pandas, Polars.
* Design and implement solutions to meet business requirements.
* Support and maintenance
* Develop and maintain metadata, user access and security controls
* Provide technical support for users and resolve system issues .
* Develop and maintain technical documentation, including data models, process flows and system diagrams




**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:**

* **Minimum 9-10 years of experience in Python programming language.** Should have worked with 3rd party libraries like pandas, polars etc.
* Experience in Orchestration, cache techniques, API’s and working on cloud platforms.
* Experience in solutioning and architecting applications.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team environment
* Strong attention to detail and ability to work under pressure
* Experience on working in credit risk IRB models.


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Stockholm. Start is ASAP, 11 month's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Qlik Sense-utvecklare
description:
Vi söker en **erfaren Qlik Sense-utvecklare** som arbetar för att effektivisera och utveckla sina datadrivna rapporteringslösningar. Uppdraget omfattar både **förvaltning av befintliga applikationer** och **utveckling av nya rapporter och modeller** i Qlik Sense.


Som utvecklare blir du en nyckelperson i arbetet med att säkerställa tillgången till tillförlitlig och användbar data för verksamheten. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samverkan med verksamhetens representanter, andra utvecklare och användare, med målet att skapa **insiktsdrivna beslutsunderlag** som stödjer uppdraget.

### **Om rollen**


I rollen som Qlik Sense-utvecklare kommer du att arbeta med att:

* Utveckla **rapporter, nyckeltal, indikatorer och modeller** i Qlik Sense
* Justera och vidareutveckla befintliga rapporter och applikationer
* Identifiera och definiera behov av **nya datamängder**
* Bidra med expertis inom **konfiguration, felsökning och optimering**
* Ge **användarstöd** och lösa frågor relaterade till Qlik Sense
* **Utbilda och stötta** både användare och utvecklare i plattformen


Arbetet kräver både tekniskt djup och förståelse för hur data kan användas för att skapa värde i verksamheten. Du kommer även att hantera **integrationer och dataflöden** mellan Qlik Sense och andra system, bland annat **ekonomisystemet UNIT4 (Agresso)**.


Eftersom arbetet sker i en svensk verksamhetsmiljö behöver du kunna uttrycka dig flytande på svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt.

### **Personliga egenskaper**


Vi söker dig som är **strukturerad, noggrann och metodisk** i ditt arbete. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och skapa goda relationer, både med kollegor och uppdragsgivare. Med din analytiska förmåga förstår du **verksamhetens behov** och kan översätta dessa till **tekniska lösningar** som gör skillnad.

### **Kvalifikationer**

**Obligatoriska krav:**

* Minst 5år erfarenhet av **utveckling i Qlik Sense**
* God kunskap i **QlikScript**
* God erfarenhet av att arbeta i **QMC (Qlik Management Console)**
* Vana att hantera **stora datamängder**
* Erfarenhet av **integrationsplattformar och API:er** kopplade till Qlik Sense
* Erfarenhet av **datahantering och integrationer med ekonomisystemet UNIT4 (Agresso)**
* Flytande i **svenska** språket både i tal och skrift


Kontakta ansvarig kontaktperson Philip vid frågor eller funderingar runt rollen, **philip.leopoldson@adavo.se****.**


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Fullstackutvecklare till Svea Bank - Payments
description:
*Vi letar efter dig som vill ta plats i en affärsnära roll där ditt arbete direkt bidrar till att skapa marknadens smartaste betal- och finansieringslösningar för våra kunder.*


Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i ett tvärfunktionellt, självorganiserande team där innovation, samarbete och ansvar går hand i hand. Vi söker dig som brinner för hög kodkvalitet, gillar att lösa komplexa problem och som trivs med att omvandla idéer till lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad.

**Om rollen**  

Du blir del av utvecklingsteamet i Sveas affärsområde Payments, som tillhandahåller betal- och finansieringslösningar i både e-handel och fysisk handel. Teamen, som består av fullstackutvecklare med styrka mot något av områdena av front- och backendutveckling, QA, UX och Produktägare. Gemensamt utvecklar och underhåller affärsområdets egenutvecklade system och applikationer, och arbetar enligt agil metod. Utveckling sker i Net C#, Angular och React, till stor del utför vi testdriven utveckling (TDD). Vår utvecklingsmiljö i övrigt består av TFS, Octopus Deploy, SQL server, Javascript och NServicebus. Vi har även ett DevOps team som låter oss göra det vi är bäst på, utveckla.

**Vem är du?**  

I den här rollen ser vi dig som har ett genuint intresse för utveckling och att hitta enkla och smarta lösningar på tidvis komplexa problem, som också har ett intresse för och vill sätta dig in i vår affär. Du är en engagerad lagspelare som trivs med att vara del av en helhet, och gläds åt gemensamma framgångar. Vidare är du kommunikativ då du dagligen har olika kontaktytor internt samt gillar att förmedla och föra din kunskap vidare till andra inom organisationen. Du har:

* Goda kunskaper i .Net C#, Angular, React
* Högskoleutbildning inom Systemvetenskap eller motsvarande relevant utbildning, alternativt motsvarande kunskap via erfarenhet
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team

***Om Svea***  

*Svea är en finansiell koncern med över 2000 anställda och verksamhet i flertalet europeiska länder. Med mer än 40 års erfarenhet är vi stolta över att erbjuda innovativa och hållbara finansiella lösningar till våra kunder. Svea präglas av en familjär företagskultur där varje medarbetare bidrar med sin unika kompetens och engagemang. Vår företagskultur betonar gemenskap, handlingskraft, och balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Välkommen att följa med oss på vår spännande resa!*

**Ansökan**  

Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och vi önskar att tillsätta tjänsten så snart som möjligt så skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryterare Fredrika Engelin på fredrika.engelin@svea.com  

  

Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Slot Games Developer (Typescript, Pixi.js)
Senior Software Engineer
description:
Development at Nolimit City (part of Evolution AB) is a challenging and exciting role where you will be part of a team dedicated to creating solutions that redefine our industry. By working in small, highly collaborative teams, you and your team will have clear ownership of one of our most important new initiatives.
   

  

 At Nolimit City, we optimize for quality, fast flows, and iterative development with short feedback loops. We have a strong focus on end-to-end ownership, continuous improvement, monitoring, and experimentation. We strive to have teams that are inclusive, helpful, and have a strong sense of ownership for what they build. Our engineers make some of the most significant decisions for the company, and we are looking for open and curious developers. As part of the Nolimit City team, you will be part of one of Sweden's fastest-growing companies and contribute to creating value for our players worldwide.
   

  

 We are expanding several of our engineering teams, including the team working on new initiatives with innovative products for our end users and work on our core products.
   

  

 Although we prefer that you're working on-site we also undertand that you have a life outside of work, meaning that working remote from time to time, leaving early, coming in late etc is not something unusual for us. A bit of a cliche; but we do in fact offer a great deal of freedom but with that comes responsibility.
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Own the product from start to finish. Decide how it is best built, tested, deployed, and monitored.
* Work with large-scale, highly available, and robust modern systems.
* Be an integral part of a team and its culture and ways of working.
* Work with automated deployment enabling release multiple times a day.
* Succeed, fail, and learn together with other competent and talented people. We believe in an environment that offers growth opportunities and see education as a result of failure that brings us closer to the next breakthrough.
* Take responsibility for system design, work together with domain architects, own end-to-end problems, manage stakeholder communication, and mentor junior engineers.


 Who you are
   

  

* Tech stack should include: JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, React, Java.
* Experience with advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks
* Experience with APIs and product development
* A passion for writing clear and sustainable code
* Experience with agile methodologies, continuous integration, continuous delivery
* Good spoken and written English skills
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and takes ownership of the change from editor to production system
* We understand that you might not have experience in all the areas listed above, but as long as you have the ambition and willingness to learn we would like to hear from you.


 Some of our technologies
   

  

* Javascript / TypeScript
* React / NextJS
* Redux / Redux-Toolkit Query
* Strapi (Headless CMS)
* Node.js and Express.js
* Java 17, Dropwizard
* MySQL
* PostgreSQL
* AWS, Ubuntu, Docker, GitHub Actions


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Software Engineer
description:

title: Senior Fullstack Developer
description:
Lylli is a Swedish tech company building the world’s first storytelling platform — reinventing how children experience stories in a digital world. By merging cutting-edge technology with captivating narratives, Lylli transforms reading into an immersive, joyful experience that fosters cognitive growth and inspires a lifelong love of books. In partnership with leading publishers, authors, and creators, Lylli unlocks unlimited access to thousands of titles — from timeless classics like
 *Alfie Atkins* 
 and
 *Peter-No-Tail* 
 to global sensations like
 *Paw Patrol.*
 At Lylli, we’re on a mission to make reading magical for children everywhere. Our app combines thousands of children’s books with personalized stories, helping families discover new ways to read, learn, and imagine together.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer to help us scale our platform, build delightful new features, and bring the joy of reading to millions of families worldwide.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Lead the development of end-to-end features, from database design and APIs to frontend interfaces.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and other engineers to turn ideas into reality.
* Build scalable backend services (Java Spring Boot, Node.js) and polished frontend experiences (React).
* Ensure performance, security, and reliability across the stack as we scale internationally.
* Play an active role in architectural decisions and product strategy.


**What We're Looking For**
* 5+ years of experience as a fullstack engineer, with strong skills in both backend and frontend.
* Solid knowledge of Java and/or Node.js and preferably React.
* Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure), CI/CD pipelines, and scalable system design.
* Strong understanding of relational databases and APIs (Postgres).
* A product-driven mindset – you care about usability, performance, and making the experience magical for the end user.
* Bonus: Experience with mobile development, audio streaming, or content-heavy platforms.


**Who You Are**
* You enjoy taking ownership and thrive in a fast-moving startup environment.
* You’re passionate about clean, maintainable code and engineering excellence.
* You love collaborating across functions and helping teammates grow.
* Most importantly: You want to use your skills to get more kids to love reading.


**What We Offer**
* A central role in shaping one of Europe’s fastest-growing children’s reading platforms.
* The opportunity to influence both product and technical direction.
* A playful, collaborative, and international team.


**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation.

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Location** 
 : Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Start** 
 : Early December 2025
   

  

**Duration:** 
 12 months
   

  

**Employment type:** 
 Full-time, hybrid (office / remote)
   

  

 We at Maandag Nordic is looking for a Frontend Developer to join a clients dynamic development team, filling in for a team member on parental leave from January 2026. This is a great opportunity for a result-oriented team player who prioritizes delivering value to users and has an interest in UX. The estimated start date is early December 2025.
   

  

 The client value curiosity, creativity, and collaboration. You’ll thrive if you enjoy sharing ideas, supporting colleagues, and driving initiatives forward together. You will contribute to both the technical and cultural strength of the team.
   

  

**About the Role**
 As a frontend developer in this team, you’ll work closely with experienced backend and frontend developers, as well as UX, Product, and Analytics colleagues, to shape innovative digital products. Your work will directly impact the experience for users on one of Sweden’s leading digital platforms.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Develop and maintain high-quality frontend solutions using Next.js.
* Collaborate in an agile development environment, contributing to sprints, planning, and reviews.
* Ensure the products you deliver are user-focused and scalable, working closely with UX and product teams.
* Support testing and quality assurance processes, including unit and integration testing.
* Contribute ideas and best practices to improve frontend architecture and workflows.


**Job requirements**
**To succeed in this role, we see that you have:**
* 2–3 years of professional experience as a frontend developer.
* Strong experience with Next.js
* Experience working in agile development teams.
* Based in or near Stockholm, able to work hybrid (office 3 days/week, 2 days remote).


**Meritorious experience:**
* Component libraries (Storybooks).
* Familiarity with Radix-ui.
* GraphQL.
* Jest for unit-tests.
* Playwright for integration tests.
* Amplitude for tracking and A/B-tests.
* Contentful CMS.
* Experience with Ruby / Ruby on Rails


**Who You Are**
 You are a collaborative frontend developer who enjoys solving technical challenges while delivering user-focused solutions. You are curious, proactive, and thrive in an environment where you can influence both product and culture.
   

  

**Application procedure**
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
   

  

**About The Company**
 If you are a good match, we would like to receive a CV in WORD format with motivation why you fit this assignment, your availability and any scheduled holidays.
   

  

 Why Maandag Nordic? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
   

  

 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Back End Developer
description:
**What We’re Looking For** 




 We’re looking for a talented Backend Developer who enjoys solving complex challenges, writing clean, efficient code, and paying close attention to detail. You’ll play a key role in building and maintaining reliable software that powers our products and enhances the experience for our users.
 



  





**Required Skills** 



* Proven track record in developing and maintaining robust software solutions
* Strong proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, and relational databases
* Solid understanding of backend development and system design
* Experience managing cloud infrastructure (preferably AWS)
* Practical experience with DevOps tools and workflows
* Excellent written and spoken English communication skills



  





**Bonus Skills** 



* Hands-on experience with React or other modern frontend frameworks
* Strong understanding of frontend development principles
* Hands on experience with Rust



  





**What We Offer** 



* Flexible work setup – on-site or hybrid options available
* Comprehensive benefits package – full details on our careers page
* Career growth and learning – we’ll support your professional development with the tools and resources you need to excel
* A close-knit, collaborative team – we’re a diverse group who value shared experiences, including annual trips to major flight simulator conventions in Europe and the U.S., often combined with unforgettable team-building activities

title: Back End Developer
description:
**Omocom söker Backendutvecklare** 




  





 Vi på Omocom växer och söker nu en backendutvecklare som vill vara med och bygga framtidens försäkringslösningar. Hos oss utvecklar du teknik som gör skillnad, vi hjälper människor att dela, låna och hyra på ett tryggt och hållbart sätt.
 



  





**Vad du kommer göra** 




 Som backendutvecklare hos oss jobbar du med att utveckla, förbättra och drifta våra backend-tjänster, med fokus på stabilitet, säkerhet och prestanda.
 



 Du kommer bl.a. att:
 


* Designa, bygga och underhålla API:er och databaser
* Skriva robust och testbar kod med C# och .NET
* Arbeta i Azure-miljö med CI/CD-flöden
* Hantera datamodeller och optimering i SQL Server
* Samarbeta tätt med våra ekonomer, produktägare och andra team för att skapa smarta helhetslösningar för vår försäkringsverksamhet



  





 Vi gillar när du ifrågasätter, förbättrar och vågar testa nytt särskilt om du brinner för testdriven utveckling och snygg arkitektur.
 



  





**Vem du är** 




 Du gillar att lösa problem och bygga hållbara lösningar, inte bara skriva kod som “funkar”. Du är trygg i din roll men nyfiken på att lära dig mer.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har:
 


* Flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling
* Djup kunskap i C#, .NET, Azure och SQL Server
* Erfarenhet av testdriven utveckling (TDD)
* God förståelse för API-design, databaser och molnbaserade lösningar



  





 Meriterande: erfarenhet av försäkringsutveckling eller arbete inom insurtech eller försäkringsflöden.
 



  





**Varför Omocom?** 




 Omocom är inte ett traditionellt försäkringsbolag vi är ett insurtechbolag med hjärtat i delningsekonomin och koden full av omtanke.
 







 Vi tror att framtidens försäkringar inte handlar om pappersblanketter och kölappssystem, utan om smart teknik, användarvänlighet och tillit mellan människor.
 



  





**Hos oss får du:** 




 Jobba i ett värderingsdrivet team som hellre säger let’s build it än så har vi alltid gjort
 



 Vara med och forma både produkt, teknik och hur vi jobbar, inget är hugget i sten här
 



 En flexibel vardag där balans, samarbete och utveckling faktiskt betyder något (inte bara fina ord på en karriärsida)
 



  





 Vi gillar att bygga snabbt men smart, testa nya idéer och ha roligt under tiden. Här slipper du jobba med gammal legacy både tekniskt och kulturellt. Vi tror på att göra rätt från början, så vi slipper släcka bränder sen (och ja, vi firar gärna när saker funkar också).
 







 Kort sagt: vi tar vårt jobb på allvar, men inte oss själva.
 



  





**Så här söker du** 




 Processen att hitta vår nästa kollega har redan börjat så hör av dig och berätta vem du är och vad du vill skapa. Vi lägger större vikt vid engagemang och potential än vid ett perfekt CV
 



 Du når oss på: alexandra.wohlfart@omocom.insurance

title: Senior .NET Developer
description:
**Senior .NET Developer - Shape Scalable Travel Tech Systems** 




  





**Please Note:** 
 This is a permanent role. This role is for
 **Swedish residents only** 
 . This role
 **does not offer Sponsorship** 
 . You
 **must have the right to work in Sweden with no restrictions** 
 . Some of our roles
 *may* 
 be subject to successful background/security checks.
 



  





 You’d be joining a highly experienced IT department of 13 autonomous agile teams that take full ownership of their solutions, from concept to deployment, following a true Azure-first, continuous delivery mindset. The culture is exceptional: collaborative, stable (many colleagues have been with the company for 10–15+ years), and deeply focused on learning and innovation.
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years’ experience in .NET / C#, Azure, SQL, and React/TypeScript
* Strong understanding of architecture, microservices, and event-driven systems
* DevOps mindset and experience with CI/CD, IaC, and Azure Cloud
* Bachelor's or Master’s degree

 Both teams work primarily with Azure and .NET, with a strong emphasis on architecture, scalability, and performance. Engineers here enjoy significant technical freedom, deciding when to deploy, shaping architectural decisions, and driving best practices in cloud-based engineering.
 



  





 The company also offers excellent benefits, AI-focused learning forums, and generous travel discounts for staff.
 



  





 If this sounds like the kind of environment where you could thrive, modern tech, real impact, and a supportive long-term culture, I’d love to share more details

title: C# Developer
description:
**About MSAB** 




 At MSAB we write code that has real impact. We help law enforcement solve crimes, we fight corruption and protect communities. If that is what you want to do every day using your tech skills – then you are welcome to send your application!
 



  





 We are one of the world’s leading digital forensic companies, developing solutions for mobile device examination and analysis used by police, security agencies, and investigators across the globe. Here, your technical skills and innovative mindset will be challenged by real-world problems and the solutions you build will matter.
 



  





**Your role** 




 Working as C# developer you develop and maintain desktop applications in .Net environment. Your responsibility is to develop our graphical interface that makes investigators and forensic specialists work easier and more effective. This requires both skills in coding as well as understanding of GUI, writing automated tests and collaboration in agile ceremonies, standups and sprint planning.
 



  





 You will have significant impact in contributing to discussions about architectural issues and technical design decisions as an important part of our team.
 



  





**Our expectations** 




 We want to hear you tell us about your ability in writing clean and maintainable code, your experience from architectural design and your thoughts on working with both new as well as legacy code. The application handles data from all our teams in R&D and you will interact and collaborate with them to find solutions. To be successful in this role we believe you have an open-minded character, and we promise that your innovative mindset will be challenged by tackling complex problems to solve. An inspiring environment indeed!
 



  





 There is much more to say about our company culture, global reach, high tech environment, our growth plans and the possibility to contribute to creating a safer world. But we save that to the interview!
 



  





**You need to have EU- or Swedish work permit.** 




  





 For more information about MSAB, please visit: http://www.msab.com
 



 Ready to make your skills matter? Apply today and join us in shaping the future of digital forensics.
 



 Department Development Role C# Developer Locations Stockholm, Sweden Remote status Hybrid

title: Web Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a
 **Web Engineer** 
 to help design and build a shared TypeScript SDK that centralizes reusable platform libraries, tools, and best practices. This SDK will make it easier for teams across our client to integrate with internal web infrastructure, improve consistency, and accelerate development workflows.
   

  

 This role is embedded within a broader platform mission rather than a single product team. You'll work in close collaboration with internal advisors, participate in a lightweight standup cadence, and lead a focused, well-scoped project. While not part of a formal team, you’ll be supported by stakeholders across the company.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Design and develop a shared TypeScript SDK for use across our clients internal web stack.
* Consolidate platform libraries, gRPC wrappers, and common utilities.
* Engage directly with web infra teams to align on best practices and encourage adoption.
* Contribute to developer experience improvements through documentation and tooling.
* Join web-focused ceremonies (advisory boards, check-ins) and collaborate across platform missions.


 What we're looking for
   

  

* Strong expertise in TypeScript, including structuring libraries and reusable modules.
* Solid understanding of web infrastructure, including dependency management, build tooling, and API integration (e.g., gRPC).
* Ability to operate autonomously, navigate ambiguity, and drive alignment across teams.
* Comfortable interfacing with a variety of teams and disciplines to gather input and evangelize usage.
* Bonus: Experience contributing to SDKs, internal platforms, or developer experience teams.


 Start: Mid Nov
   

  

 Length: 3 months plus possibility to extend
   

  

 Remote work.

title: Business Developer
description:
Lylli is a Swedish tech company building the world’s first storytelling platform — reinventing how children experience stories in a digital world. By merging cutting-edge technology with captivating narratives, Lylli transforms reading into an immersive, joyful experience that fosters cognitive growth and inspires a lifelong love of books. In partnership with leading publishers, authors, and creators, Lylli unlocks unlimited access to thousands of titles — from timeless classics like
 *Alfie Atkins* 
 and
 *Peter-No-Tail* 
 to global sensations like
 *Paw Patrol.*
 As a Business Developer at Lylli, you’ll play a key role in driving growth and shaping the future of one of the most exciting children’s reading platforms in Europe and beyond. This is a broad, hands-on role where you’ll work across strategy, international expansion, and global partnerships to unlock new opportunities. You’ll collaborate with partners worldwide, drive projects across multiple markets, and help Lylli reach the next level.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Identify and develop new business opportunities in priority markets.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with publishers, partners, and customers, understanding their needs and aligning them with Lylli’s goals.
* Develop, structure, and present proposals – including managing partner collaborations when needed.
* Support project execution and problem-solve issues along the way.
* Report directly to the CEO and management team, contributing to Lylli’s ambitious growth journey


**What We’re Looking For**
* A self-driven problem-solver who thrives on challenges.
* Curious, innovative, and a true team player.
* Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills.
* Excellent communication abilities, with high integrity and a collaborative mindset.
* Passionate about making more children discover the joy of reading.
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a plus but not required)


**Who You Are**
* Strong academic track record, preferably in business/economics or engineering.
* Final year student, recent graduate, or up to 3 years of work experience.
* International exposure, entrepreneurial projects, or other extracurricular experience are strong pluses.


**Who We Are**
* We’re a small, close-knit team who support each other – we succeed together.
* Self-leadership matters: we trust you to own and plan your work.
* We take responsibility for the big picture – both our strategy and always putting our customers first.
* We have fun at work and believe in bold thinking.
* We are pioneers, building the world’s best reading app for children.


**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm office with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation.

title: Senior Python Developer – 13986
description:
We are looking for a Senior Python Developer to join our dynamic team.
 



  





**What you will work on:** 



* Serve as the technical lead and subject matter expert for the product.
* Design and develop end-to-end solution architecture in alignment with business requirements.
* Collaborate closely with the product management team to gather and understand functional and technical needs.
* Develop high-quality Python applications using core Python, Pandas, and Polars.
* Design and implement efficient, scalable, and maintainable solutions for complex business problems.
* Manage ongoing support, maintenance, and optimization of existing solutions.
* Develop and maintain metadata, user access, and security controls.
* Provide technical support, troubleshoot issues, and ensure smooth system operation.
* Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, including data models, process flows, and system diagrams.



  





**What you bring:** 



* 9–10 years of professional experience in Python development, with strong proficiency in libraries such as Pandas and Polars.
* Proven experience in solution design, application architecture, and technical leadership.
* Hands-on experience with orchestration tools, caching techniques, APIs, and cloud platforms.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities with a focus on performance and scalability.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
* High attention to detail and ability to perform under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
* Prior experience working with credit risk and IRB models is highly desirable.

title: iOS Developer
description:
**About the role** 




 We are looking for an iOS Developer to join our team in Stockholm. You will be working directly with our customers in dynamic and engaging projects. It is a great opportunity for a long term cooperation.
 



  





**About Provide IT** 




 Provide IT is an IT company with a long history. Our team works in a hybrid model from offices in Gothenburg and Stockholm. We focus on two business areas, consulting and digital agency. In consulting, our employees have a great opportunity to work with exciting clients. During these projects they learn a lot by working in diverse teams and on various projects. At the agency, we primarily develop customised websites, systems and applications for our customers. We offer attractive salary and benefits.
 



  





 Provide IT has a great company culture that is key for our employees. We also do a lot of team building activities.
 



  






 Join us and see for yourself!

* 5+ years of experience.
* Proficiency in Swift.
* Good knowledge of Xcode IDE, as well as UIKit or SwiftUI.
* Familiarity with common iOS frameworks.

 Hope to hear from you!

title: Method Developer
description:
*TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation - Let´s make a difference together. Find out more: www.traton.com*
*Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.*
**Role Summary**
 This role is a part of TRATON Group R&D, located in Södertälje, Sweden
   

  

 Our Embedded Method Development team (TGRESMM) is expanding – and we are looking for a Method Developer to strengthen our work of defining and aligning towards common ways of working that enables efficency and compliance for the embedded systems engineering comunity.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a Method Developer, you will contribute to the definition, development, and implementation of cross-functional development methods and tools. Since we currently have several open positions in different Agile teams, depending on your background and expertise.
   

  

 Your tasks may include:
   

  

  

* Developing methods and processes based on user needs and regulations (e.g., CSMS, SUMS, ISO 26262, UNECE R155)
* Gathering and analyzing stakeholder requirements
* Documenting technical instructions and process guidelines
* Coaching, training, and supporting implementation across teams
* Leading continuous improvement activities and ensuring alignment with TRATON-wide frameworks
* Contribute and support the development and method integration in new tools or toolchain adaptations
* Taking on the responsibility as a PO or SM for a Method development team.


 Depending on your area of expertise, you may focus on:
   

  

  

* Requirements engineering (RMS)
* System and Software Architectural Design
* Software quality assurance processes (SQAP)
* Functional safety or cybersecurity (e.g., TARA)
* Supplier integration processes
* Test method development and automation


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for curious and collaborative people who:
   

  

  

* Have a background in system/software development or systems engineering
* Communicate fluently in English, both verbally and in writing
* Understand the big picture and enjoy tackling complex challenges
* Are experienced in documenting processes and creating training materials
* Are passionate about cross-functional collaboration and are skilled in workshop and meeting facilitation.
* Are experienced in Lean/Agile principles and practices


 Meriting qualifications include:
   

  

  

* Experience with Polarion, Itemis, ISO 21434, or automotive cybersecurity
* ISTQB certification, knowledge of SUMS, CSMS, or ISO 26262
* Prior roles as method developer, process owner, architect, or tester


**This Is Us**
 TGRESMM is a dynamic and growing team working across the TRATON Group. We define, implement, and improve methods that boost development efficiency while ensuring safety and quality in embedded software. You’ll collaborate with developers, architects, and testers in a modern and flexible working environment – both remotely and on-site. We work in together in Teams an operate in a Scaled Agile framework.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry.
   

  

**TRATON Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-13. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Svante Johansson, Unit manager, svante.johansson@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 This recruitment process is handled by Scania for TRATON GROUP R&D

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Job ID: 30460**
 Would you like to be a part of Nordea Finance’s journey towards modern data engineering era? We are looking for a Data engineer to drive the ambitions of one of the Fund administration value streams.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 As our new data engineer, you will become a part of our Collection team and will get opportunity to collaborate with consultants working with engineering tools and processes. As part of the DnA stream, where competences from different areas work together to deliver data driven solutions.
   

  

 Our organization is currently going through a remediation program where data transformation and our engineers play a very important role in ensuring we grasp every possibility of transitioning towards the target in the everyday tasks to be solved.
   

  

**Some of your tasks at high level will be:**
* Design, develop and maintain data solutions/pipelines
* Understanding the domain data be able to make data fit in the bigger picture
* Refactoring and optimizing current data pipelines and code base components
* Aiding in documenting the current solution as well as future development


 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for a Data engineer, with a sound grasp of technologies and an ability to bridge the gap between technical debt and modern solutions.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:**
* Demonstrate high level of data engineering skills and believe in applying best engineering practices like automatic testing and continuous integration
* Are unafraid to point out and challenge existing technical debt where present in the solution
* Are curious to onboard on new technologies
* Do not hesitate to take on new challenges


**Your experience and background:**
* You are experienced in working with developer tools like Python and (primarily) SQL
* You have a thorough understanding of data storage solutions (Relational databases)
* You are experienced in working with common IT-project management tools such as Jira and Confluence as well as under common project management frameworks such as SCRUM and/or SAFe
* You are familiar with or have experience working with the Software Development Lifecycle model
* Broad knowledge of and interest in best practice data engineering principles
* Are fluent in English


**It would be also ideal if you also have:**
* Familiarity or experience with Graph Databases and -concepts (specifically Neo4j)
* Familiarity or experience with statistics- and Machine Learning concepts, particularly Prompt Engineering and MLOps
* Familiarity or experience with reporting and -visualizations tools such as Power BI


**What We Offer**
**People** 
 come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

**A culture** 
 that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

**Hybrid working model** 
 – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

**Diversity and inclusion** 
 are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application no later than 09/11/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Mathias Priess Kappelborg at mathias.kappelborg@nordea.com.
   

  

**The recruitment process consists of the following steps:**
* Preliminary CV selection
* Online interview with the hiring leader
* Background check


**We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.**
**We build relationships.** 
 We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.
   

  

**We learn and develop.** 
 We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.
   

  

**We lead change.** 
 We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.
   

  

**We are Nordea.** 
 We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf .
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Embedded Software Engineer C++ - Heart Pump Development
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 We are developing completely new software for the embedded system of a heart pump, laying the foundation for a robust platform that meets the demands of modern critical care and strict regulatory standards. You will join our software team in Solna as we continue building a product that will meet international medical requirements, support clinicians in critical situations, and play a part in advancing life-supporting technology.
   

  

 Help us build a brand-new embedded system for Critical Care!
   

  

**Our Goal Is To Deliver Software That Is**
* State of the art – leveraging current best practices in architecture, development, and testing for embedded medical systems.
* Compliant – developed in accordance with medical software regulations.
* Reliable – performs consistently under demanding clinical conditions.
* Maintainable – well-structured and testable, allowing for future updates and improvements.
* Future-proof – designed as a solid foundation for future features, clinical innovation, and evolving technologies.


**Your role in the team**
* Design and implement embedded software in C++, from low level driver to application development.
* Translate system architecture into well-structured code that performs reliably in real-time environments.
* Work closely with system architects, software architects, software engineers, testers, DevOps engineers and other key roles across disciplines.
* Contribute to technical decisions around system structure, safety, and performance.
* Collaborate daily with our global development teams.


**What We’re Looking For**
 Technical skills we value:
   

  

* MSc in Computer or Electrical Engineering (or equivalent background).
* Strong programming skills in object oriented C++.
* Solid background in embedded systems engineering.
* Experience in ground-up product development.
* Comfortable working close to hardware in real-time systems.
* Experience using unit testing frameworks in embedded system development.
* Experience working with UML, including translating models into code.
* Analytical and systematic problem solving.
* Structured approach to solving complex problems by breaking them into smaller, manageable parts.
* Experience working with agile software development
* Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken (Swedish proficiency is a plus).


**Personal Qualities We Appreciate**
* A team player with a positive mindset.
* Communicates with clarity and transparency.
* Is caring, courageous, and ready to take ownership when needed.
* Dares to make decisions and align them with the team.
* Keeps an active dialogue around technical challenges.


**Opportunities within the team**
 At Getinge, We Believe That Developing Life-saving Technology Goes Hand-in-hand With Developing People. As Part Of Our Team, You Will Have
   

  

* Access to continuous learning—new frameworks, software architectures and problem domains.
* Opportunities to improve your technical skills through hands-on work and regular feedback.
* Mentorship from experienced engineers and architects.
* The chance to work on various parts of the software stack, from low-level to application layers.
* Involvement in an innovative project that pushes the boundaries of Medtech.
* Access to training programs to support your professional development.


**What It’s Like Working With Us**
 You’ll join a skilled and growing team in Solna, developing meaningful technology with real-world impact. We value clarity, collaboration, and purpose in everything we do. At Getinge, we offer a safe, informal, and inclusive work environment where open dialogue and teamwork are essential. We believe in transparency across all levels and support each other to grow and succeed.
   

  

 You’ll be supported by experienced colleagues and have access to learning resources to help you develop your skills over time. We also offer competitive compensation, wellness benefits, and a team culture built on trust, collaboration and continuous professional development.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 We review applications on a rolling basis. Final deadline: 25-11-20.
   

  

 Please apply through our recruitment system (we do not accept email applications due to GDPR).
   

  

**Questions?**
 Contact Hanna Noaksson, Hiring Manager – hanna.noaksson@getinge.com
   

  

 Or Sofia Ekstrand, Recruiter – sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Utvecklare inom identitets- och åtkomsthantering (IAM)
description:
*Vi söker nu två utvecklare som vill vara med och vidareutveckla identitets- och åtkomsthanteringen (IAM) i en verksamhet med stort samhällsansvar. Hos oss får du arbeta med moderna tekniska lösningar, hög informationssäkerhet och användarnära utveckling.*
 På it-avdelningen är vi ca 350 medarbetare och vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag gör att vi behöver bli fler. Som en del av vår IT-avdelning kommer du att jobba i en utvecklande miljö, med fokus på medarbetares engagemang och nya idéer.
   

  

 Vi lägger samtidigt mycket energi på att skapa en inkluderande kultur med fokus på jämställdhet och hållbara medarbetare. Vi tror att olika perspektiv och erfarenheter gör oss bättre!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Du tillhör enheten Myndighetsgemensam IT på IT-avdelningen och arbetar i ett team i ett av myndighetens agila tåg som ansvarar för att leverera stabil och säker leverans av IT-produktionen på myndigheten.
   

  

 Du blir en del av ett engagerat team av utvecklare, systemspecialist, ScrumMaster, behörighetadministratör och produktägare som tillsammans arbetar för att göra behörigheter enklare.
   

  

 Ditt fokusområde är vidareutveckling och livscykelhantering av myndighetens Behörighetsportal baserad på SailPoint IdentityIQ. Det betyder att du arbetar med implementation av nya lösningar och löpande förvaltning i IdentityIQ och
   

  

 medverkar vid uppgraderingar, revisionsaktiviteter och acceptanstester.
   

  

 Några av dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Konfigurera applikationer, roller, certifieringar och policys
* Hantera integrationer via standardkonnektorer
* Versionshantera och deploya kod och konfigurationer
* Övervaka körningar och felsöka i loggar
* Utföra manuella rättningar och hantera identitetskuber/beställningar
* Utföra uppgraderingar, patchar och releasehantering
* Ta fram rapporter och analyser
* Ge tekniskt stöd vid drift, tester och förändringar


 Du får vara med och forma framtidens IT-infrastruktur! Tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor på myndighetens IT-avdelning kommer du att bidra till att utveckla moderna och hållbara lösningar.
   

  

**Din profil**
 För oss är det viktigt att du som person är nyfiken, driven och har en vilja att ta dig an nya utmaningar.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du:
   

  

* Är självgående: Du trivs med ansvar, du tar egna initiativ och ser till att saker blir gjorda. När du ställs inför utmaningar hittar du vägar framåt och ser till att arbetet rör sig mot resultat – med struktur, fokus och driv.
* Tar initiativ: Du omsätter idéer till handling, tar ansvar för framdrift och ser till att skapa resultat.
* Ser till helheten: Du har förmåga att se det större perspektivet, förstår din roll i helheten och agerar med verksamhetens bästa i fokus.
* Är kommunikativ och hjälpsam: Du trivs med att samarbeta, strävar efter att skapa bra förutsättningar för andra och delar gärna med dig av din kompetens, samtidigt som du gillar att ta emot feedback och lära av andra.


 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* eftergymnasial utbildning inom relevant område för tjänsten
* aktuell erfarenhet av att arbeta med workflows och rules i IdentityIQ
* aktuell erfarenhet av rollmodellering i IdentityIQ
* erfarenhet av integrationer med Active Directory och webbtjänster (web services)
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av konfiguration och anpassning av IdentityIQ
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling
* minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete i Linux-miljö
* är flytande i svenska i tal och skrift och goda kunskaper i engelska


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* kunskap om Apache Tomcat, IDP och SCIM
* god förståelse för autentiseringsmetoder såsom SSL/TLS, SAML 2.0 och Kerberos
* erfarenhet av att konfigurera behörighetscertifieringar och definiera rapporter i IdentityIQ
* erfarenhet av att utveckla anpassade konnektorer i IdentityIQ och arbeta med integrationer mot applikationer
* erfarenhet av release- och uppgraderingshantering
* erfarenhet av att arbeta med MySQL eller PostgreSQL för regelbundna uppgraderingar görs samt för felsökning
* erfarenhet av Spring Boot och kunskap om mikrotjänstarkitektur
* erfarenhet av Jira, Confluence och Bitbucket
* erfarenhet av testarbete och kvalitetssäkring
* erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och ramverk som SAFe Agile Framework


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Ett myndighetsuppdrag som är viktigt på riktigt! En arbetsplats där vi värnar om att våra medarbetare ska ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid. Vi erbjuder flexibel arbetstid och möjlighet att jobba delvis hemifrån. Som statligt anställd har du även goda anställningsvillkor och ett förmånspaket med friskvård, lediga klämdagar samt goda semester- och pensionsvillkor. Vårt kontor i Stockholm ligger centralt.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och hur det är att jobba hos oss här.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att placeras i säkerhetsklass.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Vi jobbar kompetensbaserat i hela processen och är måna om en inkluderande, rättvis, objektiv och kandidatvänlig process. Därför ber vi dig att besvara ett antal urvalsfrågor istället för att be om personligt brev.
   

  

 Vi kan komma att använda oss av arbetspsykologiska tester.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontakta rekryterande chef som hjälper dig med din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka och välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund.
   

  

 Inför rekryteringsarbetet har vi tagit ställning till annonskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför ytterligare kontakt med media-/annonsförsäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.
   

  

 Pensionsmyndigheten ansvarar för den allmänna pensionen och informerar om hela pensionen. Varje år betalar vi ut cirka 415 miljarder kronor till 2,3 miljoner pensionärer, genomför cirka 911 000 fondbyten och skickar ut 8 miljoner orange kuvert. Vi har ca 25 miljoner digitala kundkontakter per år. Vi är cirka 1700 medarbetare på åtta orter, från Luleå i norr till Halmstad i söder.
   

  

 Vi gör pensionen enklare.
   

  

 #VårtJobbBerörAlla
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 2 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PSL 2025-165 | Kontakt: Anni Axelsson 010-4542764, | Facklig företrädare: Anna-Karin Åhrman Cortelius, Saco-s 010-4543914, Rickard Rundgren, ST 010-4543115, Michael Karlsson, ST 010-4543427, | Publicerat: 2025-10-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-11-23

title: Senior Embedded System Engineer
description:
**Senior Embedded System Engineer** 




 At Pricer we build scalable and industrial grade communication systems with low latency and high reliability. We are looking for a Senior Embedded System engineer to join our research team to explore the frontier of the next generation system.
 



  





**About Pricer** 




 In a rapidly growing and ever-changing retail market, Pricer offers technology and solutions that fundamentally change the traditional physical store. As a global leader and partner on the retailers’ digitalization journey, Pricer contributes to in-store efficiency and enhanced customer experience. Pricer’s customers are leading retail chains around the world within grocery, consumer electronics, DIY, and pharmacies.
 



  





**The Role** 




 This isn't a standard web-dev or app-dev job. We need a versatile engineer who loves to work across the full stack, right down to the metal.
 



 You'll be the bridge between our high-level applications and the physical hardware that powers our system. You’ll be writing, testing, and shipping code that controls devices, optimizes performance, and ensures our entire ecosystem runs smoothly. This is a job for someone who loves to understand how things
 *really* 
 work.
 



  





**Who We're Looking For** 




 We need a practical, hands-on developer who has at least five years professional experience. This role is for you if:
 


* You're a true
 **polyglot developer** 
 . You're comfortable switching between different languages and paradigms.
* You’re able to develop the same app with
 **C++/Rust** 
 , or
 **Go/Python/Java/JavaScript.** 
 Language shouldn’t matter to you, the choice of language is more of what makes sense for the goal, not so much of familiarity to a certain language
* You have a
 **strong, genuine interest in hardware** 
 . You're not afraid of the embedded world. Maybe you tinker with microcontrollers, IoT devices, or communication protocols in your spare time.
* You're a fantastic
 **teammate** 
 . You communicate clearly, share what you know, and are excited to solve hard problems with a team.
* An
 **open mind** 
 and a curious personality, thriving in a fast-paced environment.
* **Bachelor Degree** 
 or higher education
* Excellent
 **English** 
 communication skills.



  





**Why Pricer?** 



* At Pricer, you will be part of a dedicated and engaged team in a company that operates in a growing market.
* Guided by our core values—
 **We dare, We care, We win together** 
 —we foster innovation, collaboration, and empowerment, while prioritizing trust, responsibility, and teamwork to drive success for our customers, partners, and employees.
* Our office in Hagastaden, Stockholm, offers a dynamic and innovative workplace where teamwork is at the core of everything we do. We also provide great opportunities for professional development and we work on a hybrid basis, preferably three days per week at our office.







**Application Process:** 







* This role is managed by
 **UNQ Recruitment** 
 , and we kindly ask recruitment and consulting firms not to contact us directly. All applications and initial interviews will be conducted by them.
* If you have any questions about the role, please contact
 **Nina Sejdini** 
 via email at
 **nina@unqgroup.se
 
 .**

title: System Developer within E-mobility
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As a system developer your job is to drive and coordinate development, testing and management of the Electro Mechanical Power Takeoffs according to TRATON Product development process and its breakdown in terms of Embedded systems release process.
   

  

 You will also be responsible for user function development related to electrical power take-offs (PTO) in our battery electric vehicles (BEV). A user function is a complete functionality at the vehicle level viewed from the end-user perspective. It is designed to meet the needs of the end-users, and to enhance their user experience. This role involves collaboration with various departments and teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of PTO solutions.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Supervise the integration of EMPTO systems into electric vehicles, ensuring smooth functionality and optimal performance.
* Safety and Security: Ensure the safety, security, and reliability of the system throughout its lifecycle.
* System Documentation: Maintain comprehensive and up-to-date documentation for all system components, processes, and standards.
* Support to Testing, Production & Aftermarket: Collaborate with testing teams to support system validation, and assist production and aftermarket teams with troubleshooting and issue resolution.
* Lifecycle Product Maintenance: Address field quality issues, ensuring the product remains operational throughout its lifecycle with continuous improvements and updates.
* Product Data Management: Manage and update product data, including systems such as OAS (Operational Assessment System).
* Development to Production to Aftermarket Support: Provide ongoing support across the full product life cycle, from development through to production and aftermarket services.


 You also:
   

  

 Develop user functions related to electrical power take-offs, ensuring they meet the needs of the users and align with Scania and TRATON’s needs.
   

  

 Collaborate with various departments and teams to ensure seamless integration and functionality of power take-offs.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You are probably some or all the following:
   

  

 A person who takes initiative and takes responsibility for your deliveries.
   

  

 A clear communicator.
   

  

 You are interested in how the vehicles work from a system perspective.
   

  

 You have 5+ years of experience in the automotive industry within system- or function development
   

  

 Some valuable skills and experiences that could help in the day-to-day work include:
   

  

 Electric vehicle related experience.
   

  

 Project Management and leadership skills.
   

  

 If you feel that you do not tick all of these boxes but still believe you would be a good fit for the role, please send in your application anyway! We believe that the right person is more important than the exact right experience.
   

  

 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You will become part of a team of 16 people with the plan to grow during the year. We are responsible for developing the charging system and user functions related to charging and electrical power take-offs. Your future colleagues come from all over the world - leading to a very diverse and global work context. Everything we do is focused on electrification and developing solutions for sustainable transport solutions!
   

  

 As a manager I believe in creating value together as a strong and high performing team. Magic does not happen behind a screen in a virtual meeting, but rather at the coffee machine in a fika-break between the meetings. I love seeing people working together to solve complex issues, and I think I have done so since I was young and played a lot of different sports - where being part of a team has always been the common denominator in what I have chosen to do in my free time.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also host events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-11-15. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Johanna Lehander, Unit manager, johanna.lehander@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Developer till Kleer
description:
**💛 It all comes Kleer – PE Accounting byter namn**
 Kleer (tidigare PE Accounting) grundades för att revolutionera ekonomi- och lönebranschen genom ledande teknik och ekonomiexpertis. Idag erbjuder vi marknadens mest automatiserade system med över 80% automationsgrad, men vi stannar inte där – vi vill mer. Vi blir Kleer!
   

  

**Vill du vara med på resan? Blir en del av vårt team som senior utvecklare!**
 👉🏼 Hos oss blir du en del av ett starkt team av engagerade utvecklare vars dagliga arbete & åsikter är avgörande för bolagets fortsatta tillväxt. Som utvecklare på Kleer arbetar du i en helt egenutvecklad produkt, som vi utvecklar och produktionssätter och du får stor kreativ frihet och möjligheter att ständigt växa i rollen som utvecklare på Kleer! Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida
   

  

**Vår Utvecklingsmiljö**
 Vi är ett produktbolag med en modern, agil utvecklingsprocess där teamen själva sätter sina milstolpar och sköter prioriteringen utifrån uppsatta affärsmål. Vi tror starkt på att det är roligare att arbeta om man förstår användarnas behov och ser utmaningar och möjligheter. Därför arbetar varje squad med en del av applikationen, men i hela teknikstacken. Vårt inhouse-utvecklingsteam består idag av utvecklare fördelat på 5 team, där teamen samarbetar nära en dedikerad produktägare.
   

  

 Kodbasen, som till största del är skriven i Java, är välskriven och vi kvalitetssäkrar vår kod genom automatiserade tester. Vi uppgraderar löpande till senaste versionen av våra verktyg och tredjepartskomponenter. Hela miljön är containerbaserad och releaser görs veckovis.
   

  

 Vi har ett helt nytt, fräscht och påkostat kontor i centrala Stockholm (Fleminggatan 14) där vi möts, tar en pingismatch, utbyter idéer och samlas runt en whiteboard eller för ett retrospective. Vi vet att även flexibilitet i vardagen är viktigt, därför finns det även möjligheten att arbeta hybrid!
   

  

**Rollen Som Senior Developer På Kleer**
 Som Senior Developer hos oss kommer du att spela en viktig roll i att utveckla och förbättra vår produkt samt bidra till företagets tekniska resa framåt. Vi tror att du trivs i ett modernt produktbolag och i en roll där du får chans att verkligen vara med och påverka produkten och utvecklingen av den.
   

  

 Dina ansvarsområden i rollen 👇🏼
   

  

* Delta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från kravspecifikation till implementering
* Samarbeta nära Product Owner, Engineering Manager och teammedlemmar för att säkerställa att produktens vision och tekniska mål uppnås
* Ett tekniskt ansvar för en del av applikationen när det kommer till datamodell, arkitektur, prestanda, säkerhet m.m.
* Bidra med din tekniska expertis och erfarenhet för att kontinuerligt förbättra våra utvecklingsprocesser


**Vem är du?**
 Vi tror att du har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av Java samt SQL och du är inte rädd för att komma med egna tankar och idéer som vi tillsammans förverkligar! Du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat. Som person är du nyfiken och motiveras av att testa och lära dig nya saker inom ditt område.
   

  

**Mer Om Kleer Som Bolag**
 Vi grundades 2011 och är ett modernt & värderingsstyrt produktbolag. I över 12 år har vi skapat innovation och hjälpt små & medelstora bolag att automatisera sin ekonomi. Vi har en väldigt stabil affärsmodell som bolag och växer organiskt, med sunda finanser - vilket bland annat har gjort oss till sexfaldiga DI Gaseller. I skrivande stund närmar vi oss 200 kollegor och finns med kontor i centrala Stockholm, Göteborg & Malmö.
   

  

*Vi ser verkligen fram emot att höra ifrån dig!*
 Vi genomför bakgrundskontroller i slutskedet av våra rekryteringsprocesser.
   

  

*Sökord: Java 19, Spring, Docker, REST, Linux, MySQL, Microservices, IntelliJ, Jenkins, Git, Remix. Fullstack, Backend, Produktbolag.*
 Vi på Kleer ändrar sättet världen ser på ekonomi- och lönehantering!
   

  

 Vårt automatiserade system, i kombination med vår tjänsteleverans bildar tillsammans en helhetslösning som ger våra kunder möjligheten att outsourca sin ekonomifunktion, och samtidigt behålla 100% kontroll - i realtid.
   

  

 Vi har en stabil affärsmodell, där över 90% av intäkterna är prenumerationsbaserade. Tillväxten har skett organiskt och med sunda finanser. Vi har fått utmärkelsen DI Gasell sex år i rad och är ett värderingsstyrt bolag med stort fokus på glädje, ansvar, prestigelöshet och nyfikenhet!

title: Senior Backed Engineer (TypeScript) [Prisma Postgres]
description:
At Prisma, we’re redefining how developers work with databases. If you’re fascinated by the cutting-edge data infrastructure powering companies like Twitter, Airbnb, and Facebook, but want the agility, ownership, and impact of a fast-moving startup, Prisma is the place for you.
   

  

 Backed by top-tier Silicon Valley investors like Amplify Partners, Kleiner Perkins, and IVP, our small, distributed team is making advanced database technology accessible to developers everywhere. Our open-source tools are trusted by over 400,000 developers each month, with a thriving community on Discord and GitHub, where we’ve earned 43,000+ GitHub Stars.
   

  

 At the heart of our commercial offerings is Prisma Postgres, our flagship product designed to supercharge PostgreSQL with modern developer workflows, performance optimizations, and seamless scaling. Alongside it, Prisma Accelerate, and Studio, provide a world-class tookit for building with data.
   

  

 By combining the power of open-source with cutting-edge commercial solutions, we’re shaping the future of databases, one developer at a time.
   

  

 What would you do at Prisma?
   

  

 You’ll be part of our Prisma Data Platform team which is responsible for Accelerate, Prisma Postgres and the bare metal cloud that those products are build on. You'll be contributing across the stack to the projects of the team.
   

  

 To Give You a Clear Idea Of What The Job Could Entail, Here Are Some Examples Of The Work We’ve Done Lately Or Will Start Soon
   

  

* Design, implement and deploy a websocket server that will allow customers to connect to Prisma Postgres from WASM environments where TCP connections are unavailable.
* Work closely with the ORM team to define the protocol of that server so they can implement the client adapter.
* Choose and deploy a globally distributed configuration store (like etcd, rqlite) for encrypted authentication secrets to enable global routing for Prisma Postgres.
* Work together with an infra engineer to improve automation of our bare metal servers with the goal to reduce the provisioning time of new servers.
* Troubleshoot and fix a bug where a customer experiences sporadic connectivity issues.


 An Ideal Candidate Profile
   

  

 We believe the right candidate for this position should meet a majority of the criteria listed below.
   

  

* 8+ Years experience in agile software engineering teams, delivering robust web applications, using TypeScript, NodeJS and golang.
* Experience in building and scaling distributed systems. Experience with bare metal servers is a plus.
* Experience in database and backend technologies like SQL/NoSQL databases and familiarity with cloud services, APIs (GraphQL/REST).
* High standards for quality, ensuring excellence while balancing pragmatism, purpose, and a strong sense of agency—taking ownership, making thoughtful trade-offs, and driving meaningful impact.
* Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal—able to articulate complex ideas clearly, adapt messaging to different audiences, give and receive constructive feedback effectively, and foster collaboration across teams.
* You have a structured thought process, approaching problems methodically and making well-reasoned decisions. You plan effectively, setting clear goals, anticipating challenges, and ensuring smooth execution while keeping stakeholders aligned.


 What's it like to work at Prisma?
   

  

 You're likely to be a great fit for the team if you ...
   

  

* ... have an ownership mindset. As an Engineering Manager leading the ORM team, you'll have an outsized impact on decisions and the way things are executed.
* ... stay nimble. It's a startup, things change and you are ok with that. Be ready to re-calibrate often and stay flexible.
* ... be kind and collaborative. Come in ready to share your ideas and listen to feedback.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 We put our people first\*\*.\*\* Strong pay, full flexibility, and benefits that make a difference. Take the time off that you need, grow your career, and do work that matters.
   

  

* An opportunity to lead the team shaping Prisma’s cutting-edge cloud products, driving innovation in modern database tooling and redefining how developers build and scale applications — see what we’re building.
* A Fun and Supportive Team that values collaboration, growth, and continuous learning.
* Competitive Base Salary and Stock Options, including extended post-termination exercise windows.
* Fully Remote Work with flexibility to work from anywhere within our required time zones. If you prefer an office environment, we provide access to a local co-working space for up to ten days per month.
* Generous Time Off, including twenty-four days of paid vacation and paid sick leave.
* Parental Benefits, including twenty weeks of fully paid parental leave and child sick leave.
* Sabbatical Leave, with six weeks of fully paid time off after three years of continuous employment.
* Mental Health Support, including four fully paid Mental Health Days per year and access to professional resources.
* Tech and Ergonomic Budget to equip you with the tools you need, plus an ergonomic chair subsidy for your comfort and well-being.
* Annual Offsites, bringing the team together twice a year with all expenses paid retreats at exciting locations.
* Relocation Support, offering a relocation package for team members moving to Berlin after twelve months, if you choose to relocate.
* [US] Health and Pension Benefits, including comprehensive health, dental, vision, and 401k matching.


 Remote Work
   

  

 To ensure effective collaboration we can currently only accept candidates within the timezone
 ****GMT -2 to GMT +3****
 for this position.
   

  

 What is our hiring process like?
   

  

* Introductory Call with our future manager.
* Take Home Assignment followed by a debrief call
* System Design Interview with one of your peer engineers
* Interview with our Head of Engineering
* Final Interview \*\*with our CEO / COO.
* Offer


 The above serves as a basic outline, we might choose to add or remove steps based on the information that we gather during the process.
